member.name: T:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryClientSettings
member.summary: Settings for authentication with an Azure or Azure Stack service using Active Directory.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryClientSettings.EnableEbdMagicCookie
member.summary: Query string allowing use of cookies in user login dialog

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryClientSettings.OwnerWindow
member.summary: Gets or sets owner window.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryClientSettings.AdditionalQueryParameters
member.summary: Additional query parameters sent with the AD request

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryClientSettings.ClientId
member.summary: The active directory client id for this application.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryClientSettings.ClientRedirectUri
member.summary: The client redirect uri associated with this application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryClientSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes default active directory dialog parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryClientSettings.#ctor(System.String,System.Uri)
member.summary: Initializes active directory client settings with the application specific properties for client id and client redirect uri. See Active Directory Quickstart for .Net for detailed instructions on creating an Azure Active Directory application.
member.param: The active directory client id.
The client redirect uri defined for this application in active directory.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryClientSettings.UseCacheOrCookiesOnly(System.String,System.Uri)
member.summary: Returns active directory cient settings that suppress user credential prompts. Authentication will succeed if and only if previous authentication results are cached in the TokenCache or client cookies.
member.param: The client Id associated with this active directory application.
The client redirect Uri associated with this active directory application.
member.returns: active directory client settings that suppress user credential prompts.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryClientSettings.UseCacheCookiesOrPrompt(System.String,System.Uri)
member.summary: Returns active directory client settings that prompt the user for credentials only when no matching cookies or cached tokens are found. Authentication will succeed if valid cookies or cached tokens are found, or, if no valid tokens are found, the user enters valid active directory user credentials.
member.param: The client Id associated with this active directory application.
The client redirect Uri associated with this active directory application.
member.returns: Settings that prefer cached tokens or cookies over user prompting.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryClientSettings.UsePromptOnly(System.String,System.Uri)
member.summary: Ignore authentication cookies or cached tokens and force the user to enter valid credentials. Authentication will succeed if and only if the user enters valid credentials.
member.param: The client Id associated with this active directory application.
The client redirect Uri associated with this active directory application.
member.returns: Settings that require the user to input credentials,

member.name: T:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryServiceSettings
member.summary: Settings for authentication with an Azure or Azure Stack service using Active Directory.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryServiceSettings.Azure
member.summary: Gets the serviceSettings for authentication with Azure

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryServiceSettings.AzureChina
member.summary: Gets the serviceSettings for authentication with Azure China

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryServiceSettings.AuthenticationEndpoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the ActiveDirectory Endpoint for the Azure Environment

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryServiceSettings.TokenAudience
member.summary: Gets or sets the Token audience for an endpoint

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryServiceSettings.ValidateAuthority
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the authentication endpoint should be validated with Azure AD

member.name: T:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ApplicationTokenProvider
member.summary: Provides tokens for Azure Active Directory applications.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ApplicationTokenProvider.#ctor(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AuthenticationContext,System.String,Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.ClientCredential,Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AuthenticationResult)
member.summary: Create an application token provider that can retrieve tokens for the given application from the given context, using the given audience and credential. See Active Directory Quickstart for .Net for detailed instructions on creating an Azure Active Directory application.
member.param: The authentication context to use when retrieving tokens.
The token audience to use when retrieving tokens.
The client credential for this application.
The token details provided when authenticating with the client credentials.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ApplicationTokenProvider.#ctor(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AuthenticationContext,System.String,Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.ClientAssertionCertificate,Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.AuthenticationResult)
member.summary: Create an application token provider that can retrieve tokens for the given application from the given context, using the given audience and certificate. See Active Directory Quickstart for .Net for detailed instructions on creating an Azure Active Directory application.
member.param: The authentication context to use when retrieving tokens.
The token audience to use when retrieving tokens.
The certificate associated with Active Directory application.
The token details provided when authenticating with the client credentials.

member.summary: Create an application token provider that can retrieve tokens for the given application from the given context, using the given audience and credential store. See Active Directory Quickstart for .Net for detailed instructions on creating an Azure Active Directory application.
member.param: The authentication context to use when retrieving tokens.
The token audience to use when retrieving tokens
The client Id for this active directory application
The source of authentication information for this application.
The authenticationResult of initial authentication with the application credentials.

member.summary: Create an application token provider that can retrieve tokens for the given application from the given context, using the given audience and credential store. See Active Directory Quickstart for .Net for detailed instructions on creating an Azure Active Directory application.
member.param: The authentication context to use when retrieving tokens.
The token audience to use when retrieving tokens
The client Id for this active directory application
The source of authentication information for this application.
The authenticationResult of initial authentication with the application credentials.
The date of expiration for the current access token.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ApplicationTokenProvider.LoginSilentAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates ServiceClientCredentials for authenticating requests as an active directory application using client credentials. Uses the default token cache and the default service settings (authority, token audience) for log in to azure resource manager during authentication. See Active Directory Quickstart for .Net for detailed instructions on creating an Azure Active Directory application.
member.param: The active directory domain or tenantId to authenticate with.
The active directory clientId for the application.
The secret for this active directory application.
member.returns: A ServiceClientCredentials object that can authenticate http requests as the given application.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ApplicationTokenProvider.LoginSilentAsync(System.String,System.String,System.Byte[],System.String)

Uses the default token cache and the default service settings (authority, token audience) for log in to azure resource manager during authentication. See Active Directory Quickstart for .Net for detailed instructions on creating an Azure Active Directory application.
member.param: The active directory domain or tenantId to authenticate with.
The active directory clientId for the application.
The certificate associated with Active Directory application.
The certificate password.
member.returns: A ServiceClientCredentials object that can authenticate http requests as the given application.

The organizational account user name, given in the form of a user principal name (e.g. user1@contoso.org).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.UserTokenProvider.CreateCredentialsFromCache(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create service client credentials using information cached from a previous login to azure resource manager using the default token cache. Parameters are used to match existing tokens.
member.param: The clientId to match when retrieving authentication tokens.
The active directory domain or tenant id to match when retrieving authentication tokens.
The account username to match when retrieving authentication tokens.
member.returns: A ServiceClientCredentials object that can be used to authenticate http requests using the retrieved credentials. If no credentials can be retrieved, an authentication exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.UserTokenProvider.CreateCredentialsFromCache(System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.IdentityModel.Clients.ActiveDirectory.TokenCache)
member.summary: Create service client credentials using information cached from a previous login to azure resource manager. Parameters are used to match existing tokens.
member.param: The clientId to match when retrieving authentication tokens.
The active directory domain or tenant id to match when retrieving authentication tokens.
The account username to match when retrieving authentication tokens.
The token cache to target when retrieving tokens.
member.returns: A ServiceClientCredentials object that can be used to authenticate http requests using the retrieved credentials. If no credentials can be retrieved, an authentication exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.UserTokenProvider.CreateCredentialsFromCache(System.String,System.String,System.String,Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.ActiveDirectoryServiceSettings)
member.summary: Create service client credentials using information cached from a previous login in the default token cache. Parameters are used to match existing tokens.
member.param: The clientId to match when retrieving authentication tokens.
The active directory domain or tenant id to match when retrieving authentication tokens.
The account username to match when retrieving authentication tokens.
The active directory service settings, including token authority and audience to match when retrieving tokens.
member.returns: A ServiceClientCredentials object that can be used to authenticate http requests using the retrieved credentials. If no credentials can be retrieved, an authentication exception is thrown.

member.summary: Create service client credentials using information cached from a previous login. Parameters are used to match existing tokens.
member.param: The clientId to match when retrieving authentication tokens.
The active directory domain or tenant id to match when retrieving authentication tokens.
The account username to match when retrieving authentication tokens.
The active directory service settings, including token authority and audience to match when retrieving tokens.
The token cache to target when retrieving tokens.
member.returns: A ServiceClientCredentials object that can be used to authenticate http requests using the retrieved credentials. If no credentials can be retrieved, an authentication exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.Authentication.UserTokenProvider.GetAuthenticationHeaderAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets an access token from the token cache or from AD authentication endpoint. Will attempt to refresh the access token if it has expired.

member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.Authentication.Properties.Resources.AuthenticationEndpointContainsQuery
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The authentication endpoint must not contain a query string..

member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Authentication error while acquiring token: '{0}'..
